fluff.name: Fighter
entries: A human in clanging plate armor holds her shield before her as she runs toward the massed goblins. An elf behind her, clad in studded leather armor, peppers the goblins with arrows loosed from his exquisite bow. The half-orc nearby shouts orders, helping the two combatants coordinate their assault to the best advantage.

A dwarf in chain mail interposes his shield between the ogre's club and his companion, knocking the deadly blow aside. His companion, a half-elf in scale armor, swings two scimitars in a blinding whirl as she circles the ogre, looking for a blind spot in its defenses.

A gladiator fights for sport in an arena, a master with his trident and net, skilled at toppling foes and moving them around for the crowd's delight—and his own tactical advantage. His opponent's sword flares with blue light an instant before she sends lightning flashing forth to smite him.

All of these heroes are fighters, perhaps the most diverse class of characters in the worlds of Dungeons & Dragons. Questing knights, conquering overlords, royal champions, elite foot soldiers, hardened mercenaries, and bandit kings—as fighters, they all share an unparalleled mastery with weapons and armor, and a thorough knowledge of the skills of combat. And they are well acquainted with death, both meting it out and staring it defiantly in the face.

entries.name: Well-Rounded Specialists
entries: Fighters learn the basics of all combat styles. Every fighter can swing an axe, fence with a rapier, wield a longsword or a greatsword, use a bow, and even trap foes in a net with some degree of skill. Likewise, a fighter is adept with shields and every form of armor. Beyond that basic degree of familiarity, each fighter specializes in a certain style of combat. Some concentrate on archery, some on fighting with two weapons at once, and some on augmenting their martial skills with magic. This combination of broad general ability and extensive specialization makes fighters superior combatants on battlefields and in dungeons alike.

entries.name: Trained for Danger
entries: Not every member of the city watch, the village militia, or the queen's army is a fighter. Most of these troops are relatively untrained soldiers with only the most basic combat knowledge. Veteran soldiers, military officers, trained bodyguards, dedicated knights, and similar figures are fighters.

Some fighters feel drawn to use their training as adventurers. The dungeon delving, monster slaying, and other dangerous work common among adventurers is second nature for a fighter, not all that different from the life he or she left behind. There are greater risks, perhaps, but also much greater rewards—few fighters in the city watch have the opportunity to discover a magic flame tongue sword, for example.

entries.name: Creating a Fighter
entries: As you build your fighter, think about two related elements of your character's background: Where did you get your combat training, and what set you apart from the mundane warriors around you? Were you particularly ruthless? Did you get extra help from a mentor, perhaps because of your exceptional dedication? What drove you to this training in the first place? A threat to your homeland, a thirst for revenge, or a need to prove yourself might all have been factors.

You might have enjoyed formal training in a noble's army or in a local militia. Perhaps you trained in a war academy, learning strategy, tactics, and military history. Or you might be self-taught—unpolished but well tested. Did you take up the sword as a way to escape the limits of life on a farm, or are you following a proud family tradition? Where did you acquire your weapons and armor? They might have been military issue or family heirlooms, or perhaps you scrimped and saved for years to buy them. Your armaments are now among your most important possessions—the only things that stand between you and death's embrace.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a fighter quickly by following these suggestions. First, make Strength or Dexterity your highest ability score, depending on whether you want to focus on melee weapons or on archery (or finesse weapons). Your next-highest score should be Constitution, or Intelligence if you plan to adopt the Eldritch Knight martial archetype. Second, choose the {@background soldier} background.
Let me know when you're all done talking.

Of all the adventurers in the worlds of D&D, the fighter is perhaps the greatest paradox. On the one hand, a singular feature of the class is that no two fighters ply their craft in quite the same way; their weapons, armor, and tactics differ across a vast spectrum. On the other hand, regardless of the tools and methods one uses, at the heart of every fighter's motivation lies the same basic truth: it is better to wound than to be wounded.

Although some adventuring fighters risk their lives fighting for glory or treasure, others are primarily concerned with the welfare of others. They put more value on the well-being of the society, the village, or the group than on their own safety. Even if there's gold in the offing, the true reward for most fighters comes from sending enemies to their doom.
The sections below offer ways to add a little depth and a few personal touches to your fighter character.

entries.name: Heraldic Sign
entries: Fighters typically do battle for a cause. Some fight on behalf of kingdoms besieged by monsters, while others quest only for personal glory. In either case, a fighter often displays a heraldic sign that represents that cause, either adopting the symbol of a nation or a royal line, or creating a crest to represent one's self-interest.

Your character could be affiliated with an organization or a cause, and thus might already travel under a banner of some sort. If that's not the case, consider devising a heraldic sign that symbolizes an aspect of your nature or speaks to what you see as your purpose in the world.

entries.caption: Heraldic Signs
rows: A rampant golden dragon on a green field, representing valor and a quest for wealth
The fist of a storm giant clutching lightning before a storm cloud, symbolizing wrath and power
Crossed greatswords in front of a castle gate, signifying the defense of a city or kingdom
A skull with a dagger through it, representing the doom you bring to your enemies
A phoenix in a ring of fire, an expression of an indomitable spirit
Three drops of blood beneath a horizontal sword blade on a black background, symbolizing three foes you have sworn to kill

entries.name: Instructor
entries: Some fighters are natural-born combatants who have a talent for surviving in battle. Others learned the basics of their combat prowess in their formative years from spending time in a military or some other martial organization, when they were taught by the leaders of the group.

A third type of fighter comes from the ranks of those who received one-on-one instruction from an accomplished veteran of the craft. That instructor was, or perhaps still is, well versed in a certain aspect of combat that relates to the student's background.

If you decide that your character had an individual instructor, what is that person's specialty? Do you emulate your instructor in how you fight, or did you take the instructor's teachings and adapt them to your own purposes?

entries.caption: Instructor
rows: Gladiator. Your instructor was a slave who fought for freedom in the arena, or one who willingly chose the gladiator's life to earn money and fame.
Military. Your trainer served with a group of soldiers and knows much about working as a team.
City Watch. Crowd control and peacekeeping are your instructor's specialties.
Tribal Warrior. Your instructor grew up in a tribe, where fighting for one's life was practically an everyday occurrence.
Street Fighter. Your trainer excels at urban combat, combining close-quarters work with silence and efficiency.
Weapon Master. Your mentor helped you to become one with your chosen weapon, by imparting highly specialized knowledge of how to wield it most effectively.

entries.name: Style
entries: Many fighters distinguish themselves from their peers by adopting and perfecting a particular style or method of waging combat. Although this style might be a natural outgrowth of a fighter's personality, that's not always the case—someone's approach to the world in general does not necessarily dictate how that person operates when lives are on the line.
Do you have a combat style that mirrors your outlook on life, or is something else inside you unleashed when weapons are drawn?

entries.caption: Style
rows: Elegant. You move with precise grace and total control, never using more energy than you need.
Brutal. Your attacks rain down like hammer blows, meant to splinter bone or send blood flying.
Cunning. You dart in to attack at just the right moment and use small-scale tactics to tilt the odds in your favor.
Effortless. You rarely perspire or display anything other than a stoic expression in battle.
Energetic. You sing and laugh during combat as your spirit soars. You are happiest when you have a foe in front of you and a weapon in hand.
Sinister. You scowl and sneer while fighting, and you enjoy mocking your foes as you defeat them.

classFeature.name: 戰鬥風格
entries: 你採用一種特殊的戰鬥風格以做為你的專業。從下列選項中選擇一種。你不能獲得相同的戰鬥風格選項超過一次，即使你有機會再選擇它也一樣。

classFeature.name: Maneuver Versatility
entries: {@i 1st-level feature (enhances Maneuvers)}

If you know any maneuvers from the fighter's Battle Master archetype, you can replace one maneuver you know with a different maneuver whenever you finish a long rest. This change reflects your physical and mental preparation for the day ahead.

classFeature.name: Martial Versatility
entries: {@i 1st-level feature (enhances Fighting Style)}

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace a fighting style you know with another style available to your class. This change represents a shift of focus in your martial training and practice, causing you to lose the benefits of one style and gain the benefits of another style.

classFeature.name: 回氣
entries: 你擁有有限的充沛精力讓你得以利用於保護自己不受傷害。在你的回合，你可以使用一個附贈動作以回復等同於{@dice 1d10}+你的戰士等級的生命值。
一旦你使用此能力，你必須完成一次短休或長休後才能再使用它。

classFeature.name: 動作如潮
entries: 從2級開始，你可以短暫地驅策自己超越你的極限。在你的回合，你可以在你原本的動作和可能的附贈動作之後，另外再採取一次額外的動作。
一旦你使用此能力，你必須完成一次短休或長休後才能再使用它。從17級開始，你可以在一次休息前使用它二次，但同個回合只能使用一次。

classFeature.name: 武術範型
entries: 在3級時，你從可選列表中選擇一種你致力在你戰鬥風格和技巧中達成的範型。你所選擇的範型將在3級、7級、10級、15級、和18級時賦予你新的能力。

classFeature.name: 屬性值提升
entries: 當你在此職業升至4級時，你可以增加一項自選屬性值2點，或著你可以增加二項自選屬性值各1點。如同平常一樣，你不能透過這個能力將一個屬性值提升至超過20。
如果你的DM允許使用專長的話，你也可以改為獲得一個{@5etools 專長|feats.html}。

classFeature.name: 戰鬥變通
entries: {@i 4等戰士 {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
每當你達到戰士提升屬性值的等級時，你能進行以下一項更動。這種變化代表着你改變了武術訓練和練習的重點。：

items: 用一個戰士可用的{@filter 戰鬥風格|optionalfeatures|feature type=FS:F}替換原有的一個{@filter 戰鬥風格|optionalfeatures|feature type=FS:F}。
如果你通過戰技大師範型掌握了戰技，你可以將你的一個已知{@filter 戰技|optionalfeatures|feature type=MV:B}替換為一個不同的{@filter 戰技|optionalfeatures|feature type=MV:B}。

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: {@i 4th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: 額外攻擊
entries: 從5級開始，每當你在你的回合採取{@action 攻擊}動作，你可以攻擊二次，而非一次。
當你在此職業升至11級時，攻擊的次數增加到三，且當你在此職業升至20級時，攻擊的次數增加到四。

classFeature.name: 屬性值提升
entries: 當你在此職業升至6級時，你可以增加一項自選屬性值2點，或著你可以增加二項自選屬性值各1點。如同平常一樣，你不能透過這個能力將一個屬性值提升至超過20。
如果你的DM允許使用專長的話，你也可以改為獲得一個{@5etools 專長|feats.html}。

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: {@i 6th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: 武術範型能力
entries: 在7級時，你獲得一個由你武術範型所賦予的能力。

classFeature.name: 屬性值提升
entries: 當你在此職業升至8級時，你可以增加一項自選屬性值2點，或著你可以增加二項自選屬性值各1點。如同平常一樣，你不能透過這個能力將一個屬性值提升至超過20。
如果你的DM允許使用專長的話，你也可以改為獲得一個{@5etools 專長|feats.html}。

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: {@i 8th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: 不屈
entries: 從9級開始，你可以在你一次失敗的豁免檢定中重骰。若你這麼做，你必須使用新的擲骰結果，且你直到完成一次長休之前都不能再使用此能力。
從13級開始，你可以在長休之間使用此能力二次，且從17級開始，你可以在長休之間使用此能力三次。

classFeature.name: 武術範型能力
entries: 在10級時，你獲得一個由你武術範型所賦予的能力。

classFeature.name: 額外攻擊(2)
entries: 從11級開始，每當你在你的回合採取{@action 攻擊}動作，你可以攻擊三次。

classFeature.name: 屬性值提升
entries: 當你在此職業升至12級時，你可以增加一項自選屬性值2點，或著你可以增加二項自選屬性值各1點。如同平常一樣，你不能透過這個能力將一個屬性值提升至超過20。
如果你的DM允許使用專長的話，你也可以改為獲得一個{@5etools 專長|feats.html}。

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: {@i 12th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: 不屈(2次)
entries: 在13級時，你可以在長休之間使用不屈二次。

classFeature.name: 屬性值提升
entries: 當你在此職業升至14級時，你可以增加一項自選屬性值2點，或著你可以增加二項自選屬性值各1點。如同平常一樣，你不能透過這個能力將一個屬性值提升至超過20。
如果你的DM允許使用專長的話，你也可以改為獲得一個{@5etools 專長|feats.html}。

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: {@i 14th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: 武術範型能力
entries: 在15級時，你獲得一個由你武術範型所賦予的能力。

classFeature.name: 屬性值提升
entries: 當你在此職業升至16級時，你可以增加一項自選屬性值2點，或著你可以增加二項自選屬性值各1點。如同平常一樣，你不能透過這個能力將一個屬性值提升至超過20。
如果你的DM允許使用專長的話，你也可以改為獲得一個{@5etools 專長|feats.html}。

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: {@i 16th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: 動作如潮(2次)
entries: 在17級時，你可以在一次休息前使用動作如潮二次，但同個回合只能使用一次。

classFeature.name: 不屈(3次)
entries: 在17級時，你可以在長休之間使用不屈三次。

classFeature.name: 武術範型能力
entries: 在18級時，你獲得一個由你武術範型所賦予的能力。

classFeature.name: 屬性值提升
entries: 當你在此職業升至19級時，你可以增加一項自選屬性值2點，或著你可以增加二項自選屬性值各1點。如同平常一樣，你不能透過這個能力將一個屬性值提升至超過20。
如果你的DM允許使用專長的話，你也可以改為獲得一個{@5etools 專長|feats.html}。

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: {@i 19th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: 額外攻擊(3)
entries: 從20級開始，每當你在你的回合採取{@action 攻擊}動作，你可以攻擊四次。

subclassFeature.name: 回音騎士
entries: 克靈王朝的一種神秘並且令人忌憚的前線鬥士，回音騎士已經掌握並運用秘跡之力的技藝，召喚出在未被認知的時間線中的消逝之影來協助他們戰鬥。在自身力量的回音的圍繞下，他們衝鋒陷陣姿態宛如兇猛來襲的陰影集群。

subclassFeature.name: 顯現回音
entries: {@i 3等回音騎士職業能力}
你能使用一個附贈動作來在你可見的 15 呎內，一處尚未被佔據的空間處，魔法地顯現一個你自身的回音。該回音是魔法的、半透明的，形如你的黑白形象，回音持續直到被摧毀、你用一個附贈動作消解、顯現另一個回音，或你處於{@condition 無力}狀態。
你的回音的AC值為 14 你的熟練加值，HP 為 1，並對所有的狀態都免疫。如果回音要進行一次豁免，它在這次豁免中使用你的豁免調整值。它的體型和你一樣，並且會佔據空間。在你的回合時，你能精神地命令回音朝任意方向移動至多 30 呎（無需動作）。如果你的回音在你的回合結束時遠離你超過 30 呎，那麼它會被摧毀。
你能按照以下方法使用回音：

items: 使用一個附贈動作，你能消耗 15 呎的移動力進行傳送，魔法地與你的回音交換位置，且無論回音與你之間的距離。
當你在你的回合裡進行{@action Attack}動作時，你用該動作進行的任何攻擊可以用你或回音的空間作為源點。每一次攻擊的源點都由你決定。
當一個位於你的回音 5 呎內，且你可見的生物遠離回音至少 5 呎時，你能用你的反應動作來對該生物進行一次藉機攻擊，就如同你位於回音的空間上一樣。

subclassFeature.name: 並行打擊
entries: {@i 3等回音騎士職業能力}
你能激響你回音的狂怒。無論何時你進行{@action Attack}動作，你能在回音的位置上進行一次額外的近戰攻擊。
你能使用本特性的次數等於你的體質調整值（最少 1 次）。當你完成一次長休後，你恢復所有的使用次數。

subclassFeature.name: 回音化身
entries: {@i 7等回音騎士職業能力}
你能暫時地將你的意識轉移到回音上。使用一個動作，你能用你的回音的雙眼和雙耳來視物與聆聽。在這期間，你本體處於目盲和耳聾狀態。你能維持這種效果至多 10 分鐘，並且你能隨時終止該效果（無需動作）。當你用這種方法操縱回音時，它能遠離你至多 1000 呎而不被摧毀。

subclassFeature.name: 影武者
entries: {@i 10等回音騎士職業能力}
在一個除你以外的，且你可見的生物受到攻擊前，你能讓你的回音衝向該生物。在骰出攻擊檢定前，你能用你的反應動作來傳送回音到目標生物周圍 5 呎內，尚未被佔據的空間。觸發該反應的攻擊檢定將由你的回音代為承受。
一旦你使用本特性，直到你完成一次短休或長休前，你不能再次使用。

subclassFeature.name: 回收殘響
entries: {@i 15等回音騎士職業能力}
你已經學會吸收你回音上轉瞬即逝的魔力。當你的一個回音因承受傷害而被摧毀，而你也沒有臨時生命值時，你獲得相當於{@dice 2d6}+體質調整值 的臨時生命值。
你能使用本特性的次數等於你的體質調整值（最少 1 次）。當你完成一次長休後，你恢復所有的使用次數。

subclassFeature.name: 一人成軍
entries: {@i 18等回音騎士職業能力}
當你使用一個附贈動作使用顯現回音時，你能創造兩個回音，並且這些回音能夠共存。如果你嘗試創造第三個回音，那麼前面的兩個回音就會被摧毀。你能夠在其中一個回音的位置上進行的所有事情都能用另一個回音進行替換。
此外，當你投擲先攻時，如果你的釋放化身特性沒有剩餘可用次數，那麼你重獲一次釋放化身的使用次數。

subclassFeature.name: 戰鬥大師
entries: 那些致力達成戰鬥大師範型的人們磨練著代代相傳的武術技巧。對於戰鬥大師而言，戰鬥是一門學問，有時甚至囊括了戰鬥以外的專業，像是武器鍛造和書法等等。並非所有戰士都能吸收那些反映在戰鬥大師範型中的歷史、理論、和藝術等學問，但那些能做到的都是擁有出色技巧和知識的全方位戰士。

subclassFeature.name: 戰鬥卓越
entries: 當你在3級時選擇此範型時，你學會各種戰技，並藉由被稱作卓越骰的特殊骰子驅動它們。

entries.name: 戰技
entries: 你學會三個自選戰技，參見下列「戰技」條目。許多戰技將以某些方式強化一次攻擊。你只能為每次攻擊使用一種戰技。
你將在7級、10級、和15級時學會二個額外的戰技。每次你學會新的戰技時，你也可以將一個你已知的戰技取代成另一個不同的戰技。

entries.name: 卓越骰
entries: 你擁有四顆卓越骰，這四顆卓越骰為{@dice d8}。卓越骰將在你使用戰技時被花費。你在完成一次短休或長休後恢復你花費掉的卓越骰。
你將在7級、和15級時再獲得一顆卓越骰。

entries.name: 豁免檢定
entries: 你的部分戰技會要求你的目標進行一次豁免檢定以對抗戰技的效果。這個豁免檢定DC的計算方式如下：

subclassFeature.name: 更多戰技選擇
entries: {@i 3等戰士 {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
如果你有機會獲得戰技，以下的戰技也會被加到你可選擇的戰技列表中。該戰技不僅適用於戰鬥大師，也適用於擁有卓越技巧戰鬥風格或{@feat 戰技專家|phb}的角色。

subclassFeature.name: Maneuver Options
entries: {@i 1st-level feature (enhances Maneuvers)}

If you have access to maneuvers, the following maneuvers are added to the list of options available to you. Maneuvers are available to Battle Masters and to characters who have the Superior Technique fighting style or the Martial Adept feat.

subclassFeature.name: 戰技
entries: The maneuvers are presented in alphabetical order.

subclassFeature.name: 戰爭學徒
entries: 在3級時，你獲得一種你所選的{@filter 工匠工具|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=artisan tool}的熟練。

subclassFeature.name: 額外戰技
entries: 在7級時，你學會二個你所選擇的額外戰技。

subclassFeature.name: 額外卓越骰
entries: 你在7級時獲得一顆額外的卓越骰。

subclassFeature.name: 知己知彼
entries: 若你花費至少1分鐘的時間在戰鬥外觀察另一個生物或與之互動，則你可以得知某些關於它能力的情報。DM將會告訴你在下列兩個你所選擇的項目中，該生物的能力是與你相同、強於你、或是弱於你：

items: 力量屬性值
敏捷屬性值
體質屬性值
護甲等級
當前生命值
總職業等級（若有）
戰士職業等級（若有）

subclassFeature.name: 額外戰技
entries: 在10級時，你學會二個你所選擇的額外戰技。

subclassFeature.name: 精通戰鬥卓越(d10)
entries: 在10級時，你的卓越骰變更為{@dice d10}。

subclassFeature.name: 額外戰技
entries: 在15級時，你學會二個你所選擇的額外戰技。

subclassFeature.name: 額外卓越骰
entries: 你在15級時獲得一顆額外的卓越骰。

subclassFeature.name: 頑強
entries: 從15級開始，當你骰先攻時且已經沒有剩下的卓越骰時，你獲得一顆卓越骰。

subclassFeature.name: 精通戰鬥卓越(d12)
entries: 在18級時，你的卓越骰變更為{@dice d12}。

subclassFeature.name: 勇士
entries: 勇士範型專注於發展純粹的身體能力，將其磨練到完美。那些仿效於此範型的人們結合嚴格的訓練和卓越的身體素質以造成最致命的打擊。

subclassFeature.name: 強化重擊
entries: 從你在3級選擇此範型開始，你的武器攻擊將在骰出19或20時造成重擊。

subclassFeature.name: 運動健將
entries: 從7級開始，你可以將你熟練加值的一半（向上取整）加入任何你尚未加入熟練加值的力量、敏捷、或體質檢定中。
此外，當你進行助跑跳遠時，你可以跨越的距離將增加等同於你力量調整值的呎數。

subclassFeature.name: 額外戰鬥風格
entries: 在10級時，你可以從戰鬥風格的職業能力中選擇第二個選項。

subclassFeature.name: 卓越重擊
entries: 從15級開始，你的武器攻擊將在骰出18~20時造成重擊。

subclassFeature.name: 生還者
entries: 在18級時，你領悟了戰鬥中的強韌的巔峰。在你的每個回合開始時，若你剩餘的生命值不超過最大值的一半，則你回復等同於5+你的體質調整值的生命值。你並不會在生命值為零時獲得這個好處。

subclassFeature.name: 魔能騎士
entries: The archetypal Eldritch Knight combines the martial mastery common to all fighters with a careful study of magic. Eldritch Knights use magical techniques similar to those practiced by wizards. They focus their study on two of the eight schools of magic—abjuration and evocation. Abjuration spells grant an Eldritch Knight additional protection in battle, and evocation spells deal damage to many foes at once, extending the fighter's reach in combat. These knights learn a comparatively small number of spells, committing them to memory instead of keeping them in a spellbook.

subclassFeature.name: 施法
entries: 當你升至3級時，你以施放法術的能力增進了你的戰鬥實力。請參閱{@book 第十章|PHB|10}以了解關於施法的規則，以及第十一章以查閱{@filter 法師法術列表|spells|class=wizard}。

entries.name: 戲法
entries: 你學會二個從{@filter 法師法術列表|spells|class=wizard}自選的戲法。你將在10級時學會一個額外的法師戲法。

entries.name: 法術位
entries: 魔能騎士施法表中顯示了你有多少個法術位可以用來施放你一環或更高環的{@filter 法師法術|spells|class=wizard}。要施放其中一個法術，你必須消耗一個與該法術環階相同或更高的法術位。你在完成一次長休後恢復所有你花費掉的法術位。
舉例來說，如果你知曉一個1環法術{@spell 護盾術}，且你擁有一個1環和一個2環的法術位，則你可以使用其中任意一個法術位來施放{@spell 護盾術}。

entries.name: 一環或更高環的已知法術
entries: 你知曉三個從法師法術列表中自選的1環法術，其中二個必須從法師法術列表中的防護系和塑能系法術中選擇。
魔能騎士施法表中的已知法術欄位顯示了你會在何時學習到新的1環或更高環的法師法術。每個這些法術都必須是一個防護系或塑能系法術，且環階也必須符合你所擁有法術位的環階。舉例來說，當你在此職業升至7級時，你可以學習一個新的1環或2環法術。
你在8級、14級、和20級時所學會的法術可以來自任何魔法學派。
每當你提升這個職業的等級時，你可以從法師法術列表中挑選一個法術來取代一個你目前已知的法師法術。新法術的環階必須符合你所擁有法術位的環階，且它必須是一個防護系或塑能系法術，除非你取代的法術是你在3級、8級、14級、或20級時所獲得的來自任意魔法學派的法術。

entries.name: 施法屬性
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your wizard spells, since you learn your spells through study and memorization. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a wizard spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: 武器聯結
entries: 在3級時，你學會一個用以在你和一把武器間創造出魔法聯結的儀式。施展這個儀式的過程需要1小時，且可以在短休期間被施展。這把武器必須在整個儀式的過程中處於你的觸及範圍內，且在儀式結束時，你觸碰該武器並創造出聯結。
一旦你與一把武器建立聯結，則除非你處於{@condition 無力}狀態，否則你的聯結武器不會被繳械。若該武器與你處於相同的存在位面，你可以在你的回合以一個附贈動作召喚該武器，使它瞬間被傳送到你手中。
你可以有最多二把聯結武器，但在只能以附贈動作一次召喚一把。若你嘗試與第三把武器建立聯結，則你必須打破與另外兩把其中之一的聯結。

subclassFeature.name: 戰爭魔法
entries: 從7級開始，當你使用你的動作以施放一個戲法，你能夠以一個附贈動作進行一次武器攻擊。

subclassFeature.name: 魔能打擊
entries: 在10級時，你學會如何讓你的武器打擊削弱一個生物對你法術的抗性。當你以一次武器攻擊命中一個生物，直到你的下個回合結束之前，該生物在下一次對抗你所施放法術時所進行的豁免檢定將具有劣勢。

subclassFeature.name: 祕法衝鋒
entries: 在15級時，你可以在使用你的動作如潮能力時，傳送最多30呎距離到一處你所能看見的未被佔據空間。你可以在進行額外動作之前或之後傳送。

subclassFeature.name: 精通戰爭魔法
entries: 從18級開始，當你使用你的動作以施放一個法術，你能夠以一個附贈動作進行一次武器攻擊。

subclassFeature.name: 紫龍騎士(旗將)
entries: Purple Dragon Knights are warriors who hail from the kingdom of Cormyr. Pledged to protect the crown, they take the fight against evil beyond the kingdom's borders. They are tasked with wandering the land as knights errant, relying on their judgment, bravery, and fidelity to guide them in defeating evildoers.

A Purple Dragon Knight inspires greatness in others by committing brave deeds in battle. The mere presence of a knight in a hamlet is enough to cause some orcs and bandits to seek easier prey. A lone knight is a skilled warrior, but a knight leading a band of allies can transform even the most poorly equipped militia into a ferocious war band.
A knight prefers to lead through deeds, not words. As a knight spearheads an attack, the knight's actions can awaken reserves of courage and conviction in allies that they never suspected they had.

entries.subclassFeature: 限制：騎士爵位|Fighter||Purple Dragon Knight (Banneret)|SCAG|3

subclassFeature.name: 鼓舞戰吼
entries: 當你在3級時選擇此範型，你將學會如何激勵你的盟友們戰勝他們過去的傷害。
當你使用你的回氣能力，你可以選擇最多三個距離你60呎內且與你同盟的生物。只要他們可以看見或聽見你，他們將各自回復等同於你戰士等級的生命值。

subclassFeature.name: 限制：騎士爵位
entries: 紫龍騎士綁定於科米爾騎士爵位中的一個特別階級。
若你想在其他戰役設定或想塑造一個不同於紫龍騎士的軍閥，「旗將」將做為這個範型的通用稱呼。

subclassFeature.name: 皇家特使
entries: 紫龍騎士做為科米爾王室的外交特使。地位顯赫的騎士們被認為其舉止應當優雅。
在7級時，你獲得{@skill 說服}技能的熟練。若你已經熟練於它，則你可以選擇獲得下列其中一個技能的熟練：{@skill 動物馴養}、{@skill 察言觀色}、{@skill 威嚇}、或{@skill 表演}。
你的熟練加值在你進行任何使用{@skill 說服}技能的屬性檢定時變為兩倍。無論你是否透過此能力獲得該技能的熟練，你都能享有這個好處。

subclassFeature.name: 振奮之潮
entries: 從10級開始，當你使用你的動作如潮能力，你可以選擇一個距離你60呎內且與你同盟的生物。只要它可以看見或聽見你，該生物就能夠以它的反應進行一次近戰或遠程武器攻擊。
從18級開始．你可以選擇二個距離你60呎內且與你同盟的生物，而非一個。

subclassFeature.name: 意志壁壘
entries: 從15級開始，你可以將你不屈能力的好處擴展到一個盟友身上。當你決定使用不屈能力以重骰一次智力、睿知、或魅力豁免檢定，且你不處於{@condition 無力}狀態時，你可以選擇一個距離你60呎內，且在對抗相同效果的豁免檢定中失敗的盟友。若該生物可以看見或聽見你，則它也可以重骰它的豁免檢定，且必須使用新的擲骰結果。

subclassFeature.name: 振奮之潮
entries: 從18級開始．你可以選擇二個距離你60呎內且與你同盟的生物，而非一個。

subclassFeature.name: 靈能戰士
entries: 覺醒了內在心靈力量的靈能戰士使用灌注靈能力量的武器攻擊、念力鞭撻和靈能屏障來強化自己肉體力量的戰士。很多吉斯洋基人受訓成為這樣的戰士，一些極度自律的高等精靈也會這麼做。在艾伯倫的世界中，許多年輕的半夢靈夢想著成為靈能戰士。
作為一個靈能戰士，你必須通過極度的自律來磨礪靈能力量，在一個大師的指導下覺醒，或在一個學院中精進對於靈能粉塵化為武器或盾牌力量的掌握。

subclassFeature.name: 靈能力量
entries: {@i 3等靈能力量職業能力}
你內心擁有一個靈能力量的源泉。這股能量表現為每個{@dice d6}的靈能骰。你擁有的靈能骰數量等同於你的熟練加值的兩倍，且它們為你所擁有的各種心靈異能提供能量，詳情如下。
你在使用一些能力時需要消耗靈能骰，如異能描述中所述，如果一些異能在你的靈能骰全部擲完後還需要你使用一個靈能骰，你就不能使用該異能。你可以在完成一次長休後恢復所有已使用的靈能骰。此外，你可以使用一個附贈動作重新獲得一個已使用的靈能骰，但你在完成一次短休或長休之前不能再次獲得。
當你到達特定的戰士等級時，你的靈能骰大小有所增長：5 級時提昇至({@dice d8})，11 級時提昇至({@dice d10})，17 級級時提昇至({@dice d12})。
你能夠在以下異能使用你的靈能骰：

subclassFeature.name: 念力熟練
entries: {@i 7等靈能力量職業能力}
你掌握了更多使用念力異能的新方式：

subclassFeature.name: 意志護庇
entries: {@i 10等靈能力量職業能力}
被靈能力量沐浴的你意志強於常人。你對於心靈傷害有抗性。此外，如果你在你的回合開始時處於{@condition 魅惑}或者{@condition 恐慌}的狀態，你可以消耗一個靈能骰，立即結束這些狀態對你的影響。

subclassFeature.name: 壁壘之力
entries: {@i 15等靈能力量職業能力}
你可以使用念力庇護你自己和其他人。你能以一個附贈動作，選擇 30 尺的可視範圍內包括你在內的生物，可選擇數量等同於你的智力調整值（最少為 1 個）。這些被你選擇的生物將獲得半掩蔽狀態，持續 1 分鐘，該狀態將會在你陷入{@condition 無力}狀態時提前結束。
當你使用了這個附贈動作，你無法再次使用此特性，直到你完成一次長休，或除非你消耗一個靈能骰，才能再次使用此特性。

subclassFeature.name: 念力宗師
entries: {@i 18等靈能力量職業能力}
你在運用意念移動生物和物體的能力已經無人能及。你能夠使用{@spell 心靈遙控}，且無需施法材料，施展這個法術的施法關鍵能力值為智力。在每個你為此法術維持專注的回合，包括你使用此特性的回合，你都可以用一個附贈動作來進行一次武器攻擊。
當你以此特性施放了此法術，你無法再次使用此特性，直到你完成一次長休，或除非你消耗一個靈能骰，才能再次使用此特性。

subclassFeature.name: 符文騎士
entries: 符文騎士利用符文的超自然力量提升自己的能力，這是一種起源於遠古巨人傳統的力量。在任何一個巨人家族中都可以找到符文切割者，你很可能直接或間接從這樣一個神秘的工匠那裡學到了你的技藝。無論你是發現巨人的作品刻在山丘或洞穴中，還是從一位賢者那裡瞭解到符文，或者親自見到巨人，你都研究了巨人的工藝，並學會了如何應用魔法符文來增強你的裝備。

subclassFeature.name: 額外熟練
entries: {@i 3等符文騎士職業能力}
你獲得{@item 鐵匠工具|PHB}熟練，並且你學會說、讀和寫巨人語。

subclassFeature.name: 巨人之力
entries: {@i 3等符文騎士職業能力}
你已經學會了如何運用巨人之力灌注自身。你可以使用一個附贈動作，魔法地獲得以下能力，持續 1 分鐘：

items: 如果你的體型並非大型，你和你所穿戴的所有物品都會變為大型。如果你所在的位置沒有足以讓你體型變為大型的空間，則你的體型無法發生變化。
你在力量檢定和力量豁免檢定上獲得優勢。
你的每回合一次，你的武器攻擊或徒手打擊可以在命中後，額外對目標造成{@damage 1d6}的傷害。

entries: 此特性的使用次數等同於你的熟練加值，在你完成一次長休之後恢復所有已使用的次數。

subclassFeature.name: 符文雕刻者
entries: {@i 3等符文騎士職業能力}
你可以使用魔法符文來增強你的裝備。你可以從下列的被描述的符文當中，習得兩個自選符文。每當你提昇戰士等級，你都可以從此特性中選擇一個不同的符文來替換一個你已知的符文。當你達到特定的戰士等級，你可以學會更多的符文，具體數量如下表所示。
每當你完成了一次長休，你可以接觸一定數量的物品，並在每個物品上銘刻不同的符文，數量等同於你已知符文數。符合條件的物品必須為一把武器、一套盔甲、一面盾牌、一件首飾或者任何其他你可以穿著或手持的物品。你的符文會保留在物品上，直到你完成一次長休為止，且一件物品同時只能承載你的一個符文。

entries.caption: 已知符文數量
rows: 3rd
7th
10th
15th

entries: 當你研習符文時，下列的符文為你的選項。如果一個符文具有等級需求，你的戰士等級必須達到相應等級才能研習該符文。如果一個符文需要通過豁免檢定，你的符文魔法豁免DC等於8+你的熟練加值 + 你的體質調整值。

entries.name: 雲霧符文
entries: 此符文模仿了一些雲巨人所使用的欺騙性法術。當你穿著或持有一個銘刻此符文的物品，你在敏捷（{@skill 手上把戲}）檢定和魅力（{@skill 欺瞞}）檢定上獲得優勢。
此外，當你或一個在你 30 呎範圍內看得見的生物在攻擊檢定中被擊中時，你可以使用一個反應動作啟動此符文並選擇一個除了攻擊者以外的其他生物。被選擇的生物隨即變成那次攻擊的目標，並適用同樣的攻擊檢定。該符文可轉換的攻擊效應與攻擊距離無關。一旦你啟動了此符文，直到你完成一次短休或長休之前，你都無法再次啟動此符文。

entries.name: 火焰符文
entries: 此符文的魔力能夠誘發出猶如偉大鐵匠的高超技藝。當你穿著或持有一個銘刻此符文的物品，你在使用工具熟練進行技能檢定時，可以使用雙倍的熟練加值。

此外，當你使用一次武器攻擊擊中了一個生物，你可以啟動此符文來召喚熾熱鐐銬：目標受到額外{@damage 2d6}點火焰傷害，而且目標必須通過一次力量豁免檢定，若失敗則被{@condition 束縛} 1 分鐘。當目標被熾熱鐐銬{@condition 束縛}時，目標在它的每回合開始時受到 2d6 點火焰傷害。目標在其每回合結束時，可以再進行一次此豁免檢定，直到成功解除束縛。一旦你啟動了此符文，直到你完成一次短休或長休之前，你都無法再次啟動此符文。

entries.name: 冰霜符文
entries: 此符文的魔力喚起了那些在寒冷荒野中的生存者，如霜巨人般的力量。當你穿著或持有一個銘刻此符文的物品，你在感知（{@skill 動物馴養}）檢定和魅力（{@skill 威嚇}）檢定上獲得優勢。
此外，你可以用一個附贈動作啟動此符文來強化你的體能。在 10 分鐘內，你所有使用力量、體質的能力值以及相關豁免檢定均獲得 +2 加值。一旦你啟動了此符文，直到你完成一次短休或長休之前，你都無法再次啟動此符文。

entries.name: 石之符文
entries: 此符文的魔力能夠誘發出能與石巨人堪比的賢智。當你穿著或持有一個銘刻此符文的物品，你在感知（{@skill 洞察}）的檢定上獲得優勢，且你獲得 120 呎的 {@sense 黑暗視覺}。

此外，當一個在你 30 呎範圍內看得見的生物結束它的回合，你可以用一個反應動作啟動此符文，並迫使該生物進行一次感知豁免檢定。若檢定失敗，該生物被你 {@condition 魅惑} 1 分鐘。若以此形式被{@condition 魅惑}，該生物會如同陷入夢境之中無法彈動，使他的移動速度降為 0 並且處於 {@condition 無力}狀態。目標在其每回合結束時，可以再進行一次此豁免檢定，直到成功解除此狀態。一旦你啟動了此符文，直到你完成一次短休或長休之前，你都無法再次啟動此符文。

entries.name: 山丘符文 (7等或者更高)
entries: 此符文的魔力可以賦予你如山巨人般的堅韌。當你穿著或持有一個銘刻此符文的物品，你在{@condition 中毒}狀態的豁免檢定上獲得優勢，且你對於毒素傷害具有抗性。
此外，你可以用一個附贈動作啟動此符文。在 1 分鐘內，獲得鈍擊、揮砍和穿刺傷害抗性。一旦你啟動了此符文，直到你完成一次短休或長休之前，你都無法再次啟動此符文。

entries.name: 風暴符文 (7等或者更高)
entries: 此符文的魔力讓你能像風暴巨人的預言者那般瞥見未來。當你穿著或持有一個銘刻此符文的物品，你在智力（{@skill 奧秘}）檢定上獲得優勢，而且只要你沒有陷入{@condition 無力}狀態，你就不會被突襲。
此外，你可以用一個附贈動作啟動此符文來進入先知形態，持續 1 分鐘或直到你陷入{@condition 無力}狀態。在此形態結束之前，當你或另一個 60 呎範圍內你看得見的生物進行一次攻擊檢定、豁免檢定或能力值檢定時，你可以使用一個反應動作使那次檢定獲得優勢或劣勢。一旦你啟動了此符文，直到你完成一次短休或長休之前，你都無法再次啟動此符文。

subclassFeature.name: 符文之盾
entries: {@i 7等符文騎士職業能力}
你學會了如何啟動你的符文魔法來保護你的盟友。當另一個 60 呎範圍內你看得見的生物被一次攻擊命中，你可以使用一個反應動作來強迫攻擊者重投那次的攻擊骰{@dice d20}，並採用新的攻擊檢定結果。
此特性的使用次數等同於你的熟練加值，在你完成一次長休之後恢復所有已使用的次數。

subclassFeature.name: 魁梧之軀
entries: {@i 10等符文騎士職業能力}
符文的魔力永久性的改變了你。當你獲得此特性時，投擲{@dice 3d4}。你的身高增加骰值結果的吋數。
而且，你的巨人之力特性造成的額外傷害提昇至 {@dice 1d8}。

subclassFeature.name: 符文大師
entries: {@i 15等符文騎士職業能力}
你可以啟動每個你在符文雕刻者特性中已知的符文兩次，而不是一次。而且你可以在完成一次短休或長休之後恢復所有已使用的次數。

subclassFeature.name: 符文主宰
entries: {@i 18等符文騎士職業能力}
你學會如何靈活運用符文力量的轉換。因此，你的巨人之力特性造成的額外傷害提昇至 {@dice 1d10}。而且，當你使用巨人之力特性時，你的體型變為巨型，且當你保持該體型時，你的觸及距離提昇 5 尺。

subclassFeature.name: Psi Knight
entries: Awake to the psionic power within, a Psi Knight is a fighter who augments their physical might with psi-infused weapon strikes, telekinetic lashes, and barriers of mental force. Many githyanki train to become such knights, as do some of the most disciplined high elves. In the world of Athas, renowned gladiators in the arenas of the Sorcerer-Kings are often Psi Knights, and in Eberron, the psionic kalashtar view membership in this knighthood as a special honor.

As a Psi Knight, you might have honed your psionic abilities through solo discipline, unlocked it under the tutelage of a master, or refined it at an academy dedicated to wielding the mind's power as both weapon and shield.

subclassFeature.name: Changing the Die's Size
entries: If you roll the highest number on your Psionic Talent die, it decreases by one die size after the roll. This represents you burning through your psionic energy. For example, if the die is a {@dice d6} and you roll a 6, it becomes a {@dice d4}. If it's a {@dice d4} and you roll a 4, it becomes unusable until you finish a long rest.

Conversely, if you roll a 1 on your Psionic Talent die, it increases by one die size after the roll, up to its starting size. This represents you conserving psionic energy for later use. For example, if you roll a 1 on a {@dice d4}, the die then becomes a {@dice d6}.

Whenever you finish a long rest, your Psionic Talent die resets to its starting size. When you reach certain levels in this class, the starting size of your Psionic Talent die increases: at 5th level ({@dice d8}), 11th level ({@dice d10}), and 17th level ({@dice d12}).

subclassFeature.name: Psi Replenishment
entries: As a bonus action, you can calm your mind for a moment and restore your Psionic Talent die to its starting size. You then can't use Psi Replenishment again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Talent
entries: {@i 3rd-level Psi Knight feature}

You harbor a wellspring of psionic power within yourself, an energy that ebbs and flows as you channel it in various ways. This power is represented by your Psionic Talent die, the starting size of which is a {@dice d6}.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Talent Options
entries: You can use your Psionic Talent die in the following ways:

items.name: Protective Field.
items.entry: When you or another creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to roll your Psionic Talent die and reduce the damage taken by the number rolled plus your Intelligence modifier (minimum reduction of 1), as you create a momentary shield of telekinetic force.

items.name: Psi-Powered Leap.
items.entry: When you make a high or long jump, you can roll your Psionic Talent die and extend the distance of the jump, up to a number of feet equal to twice the number rolled plus twice your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 extra foot). This extra distance costs you only 1 foot of movement.

items.name: Telekinetic Strike.
items.entry: You can propel your attacks with telekinetic force. Once on each of your turns, immediately after you deal damage to a target within 30 feet of you with a weapon attack, you can roll your Psionic Talent die and also deal force damage to the target equal to the number rolled.

subclassFeature.name: Telekinetic Adept
entries: {@i 7th-level Psi Knight feature}
You have mastered new ways to use your telekinesis:

items.name: Psionic Thrust.
items.entry: When you deal damage to a target with the Telekinetic Strike of your Psionic Talent, you can force the target to make a Strength saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier. Unless the save succeeds, you can knock the target {@condition prone} or move it up to 10 feet in any direction horizontally.

items.name: Telekinetic Movement.
items.entry: If your Psionic Talent die is available, you can move an object or a creature with your mind. As an action, you target one loose object that is Large or smaller or one willing creature, other than yourself. If you can see the target and it is within 30 feet of you, you can move it up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Alternatively, if it is a Tiny object, you can move it to or from your hand. Either way, you can move the target horizontally, vertically, or both. When you take this action, your Psionic Talent die decreases by one die size.

subclassFeature.name: Psi-Enhanced Metabolism
entries: {@i 10th-level Psi Knight feature}
The psionic energy flowing through you has bolstered your mind and body. You have resistance to poison and psychic damage, and you are immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Bulwark of Force
entries: {@i 15th-level Psi Knight feature}

You can shield yourself and others with telekinetic force. As a bonus action, you can choose creatures, which can include you, that you can see within 30 feet of you, up to a number of creatures equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of one creature). Each of the chosen creatures is protected by half cover for 1 minute or until you're {@condition incapacitated}. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest, unless you decrease your Psionic Talent die by one die size to use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Telekinetic Master
entries: {@i 18th-level Psi Knight feature}

Your ability to move creatures and objects with your mind is matched by few. If your Psionic Talent die is available, you can cast the {@spell 心靈遙控} spell, requiring no components. Your spellcasting ability for the spell is Intelligence. When you cast this spell, your Psionic Talent die decreases by one die size.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Archer
entries: An Arcane Archer studies a unique elven method of archery that weaves magic into attacks to produce supernatural effects. Among elves, Arcane Archers are some of their most elite warriors. These archers stand watch over the fringes of elven domains, keeping a keen eye out for trespassers and using magic-infused arrows to defeat monsters and invaders before they can reach elven settlements. Over the centuries, the methods of these elf archers have been learned by members of other races who can also balance arcane aptitude with archery.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Arrow
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you learn to channel magic into your attacks with a longbow or shortbow.

entries.name: Create Magic Arrow
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can create one magic arrow in your hand. The arrow lasts until the end of the turn or until it hits or misses a target. You can fire the arrow from a shortbow or longbow. The arrow is a magic weapon that deals an additional {@damage 2d6} force damage on a hit.
You have two uses of this feature, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Arcane Shot
entries: When you gain this feature, you learn two Arcane Shot options of your choice (see the Arcane Shots section below). Whenever you create a magic arrow with this feature, you can apply the benefits of one of your Arcane Shot options to that arrow.
You gain an additional Arcane Shot option of your choice at 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Shots
entries: The Arcane Arrow feature lets you choose Arcane Shot options at certain levels. The options are presented here in alphabetical order. These are all magical effects.

subclassFeature.name: Archer's Lore
entries: At 3rd level, you learn a few skills relating to the typical duties of an Arcane Archer. You learn to understand magical theory and develop survival skills for wandering the wilds.
You gain proficiency in two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Stealth}, and {@skill Survival}.

subclassFeature.name: Conjure Arrows
entries: At 7th level, you learn a minor but useful magical trick. As an action, you can conjure 20 nonmagical arrows. The arrows appear in your hand or in a container, such as a quiver, on your body. The arrows remain for 10 minutes or until you use this feature again; they then vanish.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Arcane Shot
entries: At 7th level, you learn an additional Arcane Shot option.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Arcane Shot
entries: At 10th level, you learn an additional Arcane Shot option.

subclassFeature.name: Ever-Ready Arrow
entries: Starting at 15th level, you can conjure forth a magic-infused arrow more often than before. One minute after expending your last remaining use of Arcane Arrow, you regain one use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Arcane Shot
entries: At 15th level, you learn an additional Arcane Shot option.

subclassFeature.name: Deadly Arrow
entries: At 18th level, your Arcane Arrow's bonus damage increases to {@damage 4d6} force damage.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Arcane Shot
entries: At 18th level, you learn an additional Arcane Shot option.

subclassFeature.name: Knight
entries: The Knight is a colossus on the battlefield who can shrug off attacks and protect allies from harm. Knights fight from the saddle when they can, and in combat they are expected to seek out and lock down the mightiest of the enemy's forces. On adventures, they are the armored bulwark that strives to keep the rest of the party safe.

subclassFeature.name: Born to the Saddle
entries: Starting at 3rd level, mounting or dismounting a creature costs you only 5 feet of movement, rather than half your speed. In addition, you have advantage on saving throws made to avoid falling off your mount. If you fall off it, you can automatically land on your feet if you aren't {@condition incapacitated} and you fall less than 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Implacable Mark
entries: At 3rd level, you excel at foiling attacks and protecting your allies by menacing your foes. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, the target is marked by you until the end of your next turn. A creature ignores this effect if the creature can't be {@condition frightened}.
The marked target has disadvantage on any attack roll against a creature other than you or someone else who marked it.

If a target marked by you is within 5 feet of you on its turn and it moves at least 1 foot or makes an attack that suffers disadvantage from this feature, you can make one melee weapon attack against it using your reaction. This attack roll has advantage, and if it hits, the attack's weapon deals extra damage to the target equal to your fighter level.

You can make this special attack even if you have already expended your reaction this round, but not if you have already used your reaction this turn. You can make this attack three times, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Noble Cavalry
entries: At 7th level, you gain proficiency in two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill History}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Persuasion}, or {@skill Religion}. Alternatively, you learn one language of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Hold the Line
entries: At 10th level, you master the ability to harass and slow your enemies. As a reaction when a creature moves at least 1 foot within 5 feet of you, you can make one melee weapon attack against that creature. If you hit, the attack's weapon deals extra damage to the target equal to half your fighter level, and the target's speed is reduced to 0 until the end of this turn.

subclassFeature.name: Rapid Strike
entries: Starting at 15th level, you learn to trade accuracy for swift strikes. If you have advantage on a weapon attack against a target on your turn, you can forgo that advantage to immediately make an additional weapon attack against the same target as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Defender's Blade
entries: At 18th level, you respond to danger with extraordinary vigilance. You can use your reaction for an opportunity attack even if you have already expended your reaction this round, but not if you have already used your reaction this turn.
In addition, you gain a +1 bonus to AC while wearing heavy armor.

subclassFeature.name: Samurai
entries: The Samurai is a fighter who draws on an implacable fighting spirit to overcome enemies. A Samurai's willpower is nearly unbreakable, and the enemies in a Samurai's path have two choices: yield or die fighting.

subclassFeature.name: Fighting Spirit
entries: Starting at 3rd level, the might of your willpower can shield you and help you strike true. As a bonus action on your turn, you can give yourself two benefits: advantage on all attack rolls and resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. These benefits last until the end of your next turn.
You can use this feature three times. You regain all expended uses of it when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Elegant Courtier
entries: Starting at 7th level, your discipline and attention to detail allow you to excel in social situations that require strict adherence to etiquette. You can add your Wisdom modifier to any Charisma check you make to persuade or please a noble or anyone else of high social station.
You also gain proficiency in the {@skill History}, {@skill Insight}, or {@skill Persuasion} skill (choose one). Alternatively, you learn one language of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Unbreakable Will
entries: At 10th level, your superior willpower allows you to shrug off mind-assaulting effects. You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency in Intelligence or Charisma saving throws (choose one).

subclassFeature.name: Rapid Strike
entries: Starting at 15th level, you learn to trade accuracy for swift strikes. If you have advantage on a weapon attack against a target on your turn, you can forgo that advantage to immediately make an additional weapon attack against the same target as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Strength Before Death
entries: Starting at 18th level, your fighting spirit can delay the grasp of death. If you take damage that would reduce you to 0 hit points, you can delay that damage and immediately take a bonus turn, interrupting the current turn. You don't take the damage until the bonus turn ends. It is possible to do things, such as gaining resistance, that change how much of that damage you take.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Sharpshooter
entries: The Sharpshooter is a master of ranged combat. An excellent sniper and eagle-eyed scout, this fighter is a perilous foe who can defeat an entire war band so long as they are kept at range.

subclassFeature.name: Steady Aim
entries: Beginning when you choose this archetype at 3rd level, your aim becomes deadly. As a bonus action on your turn, you can take careful aim at a creature you can see that is within range of a ranged weapon you're wielding. Until the end of this turn, your ranged attacks with that weapon gain two benefits against the target:

items: The attacks ignore half and three-quarters cover.
On each hit, the weapon deals additional damage to the target equal to 2 + half your fighter level.

entries: You can use this feature three times. You regain all expended uses of it when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Careful Eyes
entries: Starting at 7th level, you excel at picking out hidden enemies and other threats. You can take the {@action Search} action as a bonus action.
You also gain proficiency in the {@skill Perception}, {@skill Investigation}, or {@skill Survival} skill (choose one).

subclassFeature.name: Close-Quarters Shooting
entries: At 10th level, you learn to handle yourself in close combat. Making a ranged attack roll while within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose disadvantage on your roll.
In addition, if you hit a creature within 5 feet of you with a ranged attack on your turn, that creature can't take reactions until the end of this turn.

subclassFeature.name: Rapid Strike
entries: Starting at 15th level, you learn to trade accuracy for swift strikes. If you have advantage on a weapon attack against a target on your turn, you can forgo that advantage to immediately make an additional weapon attack against the same target as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Snap Shot
entries: Starting at 18th level, you are ever ready to spring into action. If you take the {@action Attack} action on your first turn of a combat, you can make one additional ranged weapon attack as part of that action.

subclassFeature.name: Rune Knight
entries: You discovered how to enhance your martial prowess using the supernatural power of runes. The ancient practice of rune magic originated with giants. {@i Skiltgravr} ("rune cutters") can be found among any type of giants, and you likely learned your methods first or second hand from such a mystical artisan. Whether you found the giant's work carved into a hill or cave, learned of the runes from a traveling sage, or met the giant in person, you studied the giant's craft. In time, you learned how to carve and apply runes to your equipment and how to invoke their magic, ultimately becoming a Rune Knight.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: {@i 3等符文騎士職業能力}
You gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|PHB}, and you learn to speak, read, and write Giant.

subclassFeature.name: Giant Might
entries: {@i 3等符文騎士職業能力}
You can imbue yourself with the might of giants. As a bonus action, you magically gain the following benefits, which last for 1 minute:

items: If you are smaller than Large, you become Large, along with anything you are wearing. If you lack the room to become Large, your size doesn't change.
You have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
Your weapon attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d6} damage.

entries: You can use this feature twice, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Rune Magic
entries: {@i 3等符文騎士職業能力}

You learn how to use runes to enhance your gear. When you gain this feature, you learn how to inscribe two runes of your choice on weapons, armor, or shields (see "{@filter Rune Options|optionalfeatures|feature type=RN|source=UAFighterRangerRogue}").

Whenever you finish a long rest, you can touch a number of objects equal to the number of runes you know, and you inscribe a different rune onto each of the objects. To be eligible, an object must be a weapon, a suit of armor, or a shield.
Your rune remains on an object until you finish a long rest, and an object can bear only one of your runes.
Each time you gain a level in this class, you can replace one rune you know with a different one.

subclassFeature.name: Rune Options
entries: Here are rune options for the Rune Magic feature. They are all magical effects. If a rune requires a saving throw, your Rune Magic save DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Defensive Runes
entries: {@i 7等符文騎士職業能力}

You learn to invoke your rune magic to protect your allies. When another creature you can see within 60 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to grant a bonus to the creature's AC against that attack. The bonus equals 1 + your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +2).
In addition, you learn one new rune of your choice from the Rune Magic feature (for a total of three).

subclassFeature.name: Great Stature
entries: {@i 10等符文騎士職業能力}

The magic of your runes permanently alters you. When you gain this feature, roll  {@dice 3d4}. You grow a number of inches in height equal to the roll. Moreover, the extra damage you deal with your Giant Might feature increases to  {@dice 1d8}.
In addition, you learn one new rune of your choice from your Rune Magic feature (for a total of four).

subclassFeature.name: Rune Magic Mastery
entries: {@i 15等符文騎士職業能力}
You can invoke each rune you know from your Rune Magic feature twice, rather than once, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.
In addition, you learn one new rune of your choice from the Rune Magic feature (for a total of five).

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of the All Father
entries: {@i 18等符文騎士職業能力}

You learn how to share your rune magic with your allies. When you use your Giant Might feature, you can choose one willing creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The chosen creature also gains the benefits of your Giant Might feature.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Warrior
entries: Awakening to the psionic power within themselves, a Psychic Warrior is a fighter who augments their physical might with psychically infused weapon strikes, telekinetic lashes, and barriers of mental force.

As a Psychic Warrior, you might have honed your psionic abilities through your own disciplined practice, unlocked it under the tutelage of a master, or developed it at an academy dedicated to wielding the mind's power as both weapon and shield.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Armament
entries: {@i 3rd-level Psychic Warrior feature}

You can channel your psychic power to magically augment your prowess. When you finish a long rest, choose whether to augment your defenses or your strikes. The chosen benefit lasts until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Augmented Defenses
entries: When you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to roll a {@dice d10} and reduce the amount of damage taken by the number rolled. When you reach 10th level in this class, the die changes to a {@dice d12}.

entries.name: Augmented Strikes
entries: Once during each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can also deal {@damage 1d4} psychic damage to that target. When you reach 10th level in this class, the psychic damage increases to {@dice 1d6}.

subclassFeature.name: Telekinetic Hand
entries: {@i 3rd-level Psychic Warrior feature}
You learn the {@spell 法師之手} cantrip. You can cast it without components, and you can make the spectral hand {@condition invisible}. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

subclassFeature.name: Strength of Mind
entries: {@i 7th-level Psychic Warrior feature}

As a bonus action, you can telekinetically lash out at a creature you can see within 20 feet of you. The target must make a Strength saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier. On a failed save, the target takes force damage equal to {@dice 2d6} plus your Intelligence modifier and is telekinetically moved 15 feet directly toward or away from you (your choice). On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't moved.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Armament Improvement
entries: {@i 10th-level Psychic Warrior feature}
When you reach 10th level in this class, your Augmented Defenses dice increases to {@dice 1d12}, and your Augmented Strikes dice increases to a {@dice d6}.

subclassFeature.name: Telekinetic Bulwark
entries: {@i 10th-level Psychic Warrior feature}

When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can forgo one of your attacks to project a bastion of psionic power in a 10-foot radius around yourself. It lasts for 1 minute or until you're {@condition incapacitated}. For the duration, you and your allies in that area gain the benefits of half cover and have advantage on Strength saving throws.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest or until after you use your Second Wind feature.

subclassFeature.name: Agonizing Strikes
entries: {@i 15th-level Psychic Warrior feature}

Your attacks can channel psychic agony. When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can also deal {@damage 2d10} psychic damage to that target and force it to make a Constitution saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier. Unless the save succeeds, the target falls {@condition prone}, and it suffers disadvantage on ability checks until the end of your next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Dreadnaught
entries: {@i 18th-level Psychic Warrior feature}

The power of your mind suffuses your entire being, making you a nigh-unstoppable force on the battlefield. Using your reaction when you take damage, you can give yourself the following benefits for 1 minute or until you're {@condition incapacitated}:

items: At the start of each of your turns, you regain 10 hit points.
Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.
If you're {@condition prone}, you can stand up by spending 5 feet of movement.

entries: Once you activate this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Monster Hunter
entries: As an archetypal Monster Hunter, you are an expert at defeating supernatural threats. Typically mentored by an older, experienced Monster Hunter, you learn to overcome a variety of unnatural defenses and attacks, including those of undead, lycanthropes, and other creatures of horror.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Perception}. You can choose to gain proficiency with {@item thieves' tools|phb} in place of one skill choice.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Superiority
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a set of abilities that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

entries.name: Superiority Dice
entries: You have four superiority dice, which are {@dice d8}s. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a long or short rest. You gain another superiority die at 7th level and one more at 15th level.

entries.name: Using Superiority Dice
entries: You can expend superiority dice to gain a number of different benefits:

items: When you make a weapon attack against a creature, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the attack roll. You can use this ability before or after making the attack roll, but before any of the effects of the attack are applied.

When you damage a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the damage roll. You can use this ability after rolling damage. If the attack causes the target to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration, it has disadvantage on that save.

When you make an Intelligence, a Wisdom, or a Charisma saving throw, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the roll. You can use this feature only before you learn if the save succeeded or failed.

When you make a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check to detect a hidden creature or object, or a Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check to determine if someone is lying to you, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the roll. You can use this feature after seeing the total but before learning if you succeeded or failed.

subclassFeature.name: Hunter's Mysticism
entries: At 3rd level, your study of the supernatural gives you a limited ability to use magic. You can cast {@spell 偵測魔法} as a ritual. You can cast {@spell 防護善惡}, but you cannot cast it again with this feature until you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
In addition, you gain the ability to speak one of the following languages of your choice: Abyssal, Celestial, or Infernal.

subclassFeature.name: Monster Slayer
entries: At 7th level, whenever you expend superiority dice to add to a damage roll, you can expend up to two dice instead of just one, adding both to the roll. Both dice are expended as normal. If the target of your attack is an aberration, a fey, a fiend, or an undead, you deal maximum damage with both dice, instead of rolling them.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: At 10th level, your superiority dice turn into {@dice d10}s. At 18th level, they turn into {@dice d12}s.

subclassFeature.name: Relentless
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you roll initiative and have no superiority dice remaining, you regain 1 superiority die.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: At 18th level, your superiority dice turn into {@dice d12}s.

subclassFeature.name: Cavalier
entries: The archetypal Cavalier excels at mounted combat. Usually born to nobility and raised in a royal court, a Cavalier is equally at home leading a cavalry charge or exchanging witty repartee at a state dinner.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Performance}, or {@skill Persuasion}. You can choose to gain one tool proficiency in place of one skill proficiency.

subclassFeature.name: Born to the Saddle
entries: At 3rd level, you have advantage on saving throws made to avoid falling off your mount. If you fall off your mount, you always land on your feet if you are capable of taking actions. Mounting or dismounting a creature costs you only 5 feet of movement, rather than half your speed.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Superiority
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a set of abilities that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

entries.name: Superiority Dice
entries: You have four superiority dice, which are {@dice d8}s. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.
You gain another superiority die at 7th level and one more at 15th level.

entries.name: Using Superiority Dice
entries: You can expend superiority dice to gain a number of different benefits:

items: When you make a check to influence or control a creature you are riding, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the check. You apply this bonus after making the check but before learning if it was successful.

When you make a weapon attack against a creature, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the attack roll. You can use this ability before or after making the attack roll, but before any of the effects of the attack are applied.

When you make an attack with a lance while mounted, you can expend one superiority die to add it to your damage roll. In addition, the target of the attack must make a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or be knocked {@condition prone}.

If either you or your mount is hit by an attack while you are mounted, you can expend one superiority die as a reaction, adding the number rolled to your or your mount's AC. If the attack still hits, you or your mount take half damage from it.

subclassFeature.name: Ferocious Charger
entries: At 7th level, you gain additional benefits when you use superiority dice to increase your damage when you attack with a lance. You can expend up to two superiority dice on the attack, adding both to the damage roll. If you spend two dice, the target has disadvantage on its Strength saving throw to avoid being knocked {@condition prone}.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: At 10th level, your superiority dice turn into {@dice d10}s. At 18th level, they turn into {@dice d12}s.

subclassFeature.name: Relentless
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you roll initiative and have no superiority dice remaining, you regain 1 superiority die.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: At 18th level, your superiority dice turn into {@dice d12}s.

subclassFeature.name: Scout
entries: The archetypal Scout excels at finding safe passage through dangerous regions. Scouts usually favor light armor and ranged weapons, but they are comfortable using heavier gear when faced with intense fighting.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in three of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Acrobatics}, {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Stealth}, or {@skill Survival}. You can choose to gain proficiency with {@item thieves' tools|phb} in place of one skill choice.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Superiority
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a set of abilities that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

entries.name: Superiority Dice
entries: You have four superiority dice, which are {@dice d8}s. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a long or short rest. You gain another superiority die at 7th level and one more at 15th level.

entries.name: Using Superiority Dice
entries: You can expend superiority dice to gain a number of different benefits:

items: When you make a check that allows you to apply your proficiency in {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Stealth}, or {@skill Survival}, you can expend one superiority die to bolster the check. Add half the number rolled on the superiority die (rounding up) to your check. You apply this bonus after making the check but before learning if it was successful.

When you make a weapon attack against a creature, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the attack roll. You can use this ability before or after making the attack roll, but before any of the effects of the attack are applied.

If you are hit by an attack while wearing light or medium armor, you can expend one superiority die as a reaction, adding the number rolled to your AC. If the attack still hits, you take half damage from it.

subclassFeature.name: Natural Explorer
entries: You are particularly familiar with one type of natural environment and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions. Choose one type of favored terrain: arctic, coast, desert, forest, grassland, mountain, swamp, or the Underdark. When you make an Intelligence or Wisdom check related to your favored terrain, your proficiency bonus is doubled if you are using a skill that you're proficient in.
While traveling for an hour or more in your favored terrain, you gain the following benefits:

items: Difficult terrain doesn't slow your group's travel.
Your group can't become lost except by magical means.
Even when you are engaged in another activity while traveling (such as foraging, navigating, or tracking), you remain alert to danger.
If you are traveling alone, you can move stealthily at a normal pace.
When you forage, you find twice as much food as you normally would.
While tracking other creatures, you also learn their exact number, their sizes, and how long ago they passed through the area.

entries: You choose additional favored terrain types at 7th and 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Superiority Die
entries: You gain another superiority die at 7th level.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: At 10th level, your superiority dice turn into {@dice d10}s. At 18th level, they turn into {@dice d12}s.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Superiority Die
entries: You gain another superiority die at 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Relentless
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you roll initiative and have no superiority dice remaining, you regain 1 superiority die.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: At 18th level, your superiority dice turn into {@dice d12}s.

subclassFeature.name: Cavalier v2
entries: The archetypal Cavalier excels at mounted combat. Usually born among the nobility and raised at court, a Cavalier is equally at home leading a cavalry charge or exchanging repartee at a state dinner. Cavaliers also learn how to guard those in their charge from harm, often serving as the protectors of their superiors and of the weak. Drawn to right wrongs or earn prestige, many of these fighters leave their lives of comfort to embark on glorious adventure.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill History}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Performance}, or {@skill Persuasion}. Alternatively, you learn one language of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Born to the Saddle
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your mastery as a rider becomes apparent. You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid falling off your mount. If you fall off your mount and descend no more than 10 feet, you can land on your feet if you're not {@condition incapacitated}.
Finally, mounting or dismounting a creature costs you only 5 feet of movement, rather than half your speed.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Superiority
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a set of combat abilities, referred to as maneuvers, which are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

entries.name: Superiority Dice
entries: You have four superiority dice, which are {@dice d8}s. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.
You gain another superiority die at 7th level and one more at 15th level.

entries.name: Maneuvers
entries: You spend your superiority dice on your maneuvers. You can use more than one maneuver per turn, but no more than one maneuver per attack. You know the maneuvers detailed under "Maneuvers" below.

subclassFeature.name: Maneuvers
entries: The maneuvers are presented in alphabetical order.

subclassFeature.name: Ferocious Charger
entries: At 7th level, you gain additional benefits when you use your Trip Attack maneuver. You can expend up to two superiority dice on it, adding both dice to the damage roll. When you spend two dice in this way, the target has disadvantage on its Strength saving throw to avoid being knocked {@condition prone}.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: At 10th level, your superiority dice turn into {@dice d10}s. At 18th level, they turn into {@dice d12}s.

subclassFeature.name: Relentless
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you roll initiative and have no superiority dice remaining, you regain one superiority die.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: At 18th level, your superiority dice turn into {@dice d12}s.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Archer v2
entries: An Arcane Archer studies a unique elven method of archery that weaves magic into attacks to produce supernatural effects. Among elves, Arcane Archers are some of their most elite warriors. These archers stand watch over the fringes of elven domains, keeping a keen eye out for trespassers and using magic-infused arrows to defeat monsters and invaders before they can reach elven settlements. Over the centuries, the methods of these elf archers have been learned by members of other races who can also balance arcane aptitude with archery.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Arrow
entries: At 3rd level, you learn to unleash special magical effects with some of your shots. When you gain this feature, you learn two Arcane Shot options of your choice (see the "Arcane Shot Options" section below).

Once per turn when you fire a magic arrow from a shortbow or longbow as part of the {@action Attack} action, you can apply one of your Arcane Shot options to that arrow. You decide to use the option when the arrow hits, unless the option doesn't involve an attack roll. You have two uses of this ability, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a short or long rest.
You gain an additional Arcane Shot option of your choice when you reach certain levels in this class: 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level. Each option also improves when you become an 18th-level fighter.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Shot
entries: The Arcane Shot feature lets you choose options for it at certain levels. The options are presented here in alphabetical order. They are all magical effects, and each one is associated with one of the schools of magic.
If an option requires a saving throw, your Arcane Shot save DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Archer's Lore
entries: At 3rd level, you learn magical theory or some of the secrets of nature—typical for practitioners of this elven martial tradition. You gain proficiency in either the {@skill Arcana} or {@skill Nature} skill.

subclassFeature.name: Magic Arrow
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain the ability to infuse arrows with magic. Whenever you fire a nonmagical arrow from a shortbow or longbow, you can make it a magic arrow, with a +1 bonus to the attack and damage rolls. The magic fades from the arrow immediately after it hits or misses its target.

subclassFeature.name: Curving Shot
entries: At 7th level, you learn how to direct an errant arrow toward a new target. When you make an attack roll with a magic arrow and miss, you can use a bonus action to reroll the attack roll against a different target within 60 feet of the original target.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Arcane Shot
entries: At 7th level, you learn an additional Arcane Shot option.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Arcane Shot
entries: At 10th level, you learn an additional Arcane Shot option.

subclassFeature.name: Ever-Ready Shot
entries: Starting at 15th level, your magical archery is ever available to you when you need it most. If you roll initiative and have no uses of Arcane Shot remaining, you regain one use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Arcane Shot
entries: At 15th level, you learn an additional Arcane Shot option.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Arcane Shot
entries: At 18th level, you learn an additional Arcane Shot option.

subclassFeature.name: Brute
entries: Brutes are simple warriors who rely on mighty attacks and their own durability to overcome their enemies. Some brutes combine this physical might with tactical cunning. Others just hit things until those things stop hitting back.

subclassFeature.name: Brute Force
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you're able to strike with your weapons with especially brutal force. Whenever you hit with a weapon that you're proficient with and deal damage, the weapon's damage increases by an amount based on your level in this class, as shown on the Brute Bonus Damage table.

entries.caption: Brute Bonus Damage
rows: 3rd
{@dice 1d4}
10th
{@dice 1d6}
16th

subclassFeature.name: Brutish Durability
entries: Beginning at 7th level, your toughness allows you to shrug off assaults that would devastate others.

Whenever you make a saving throw, roll {@dice 1d6} and add the die to your saving throw total. If applying this bonus to a death saving throw increases the total to 20 or higher, you gain the benefits of rolling a 20 on the {@dice d20}.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Fighting Style
entries: At 10th level, you can choose a second option from the Fighting Style feature.

subclassFeature.name: Devastating Critical
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you score a critical hit with a weapon attack, you gain a bonus to that weapon's damage roll equal to your level in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Survivor
entries: At 18th level, you attain the pinnacle of resilience in battle. At the start of each of your turns in combat, you regain hit points equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 hit point). You don't gain this benefit if you have 0 hit points or if you have more than half of your hit points left.

subclassFeature.name: 魔射手
entries: 魔射手鑽研著那將魔法編入攻擊以產生超自然效果的獨特精靈箭技。魔射手是精靈中最精銳的戰士。他們會駐足守望著精靈領域的疆界，銳眼緊盯著入侵者，並射出灌注魔法的箭矢以在怪物和入侵者闖入精靈的居住地之前擊潰它們。在幾個世紀以來，這種精靈箭技也已經被其他能夠在祕法才能和弓道中找到平衡的種族所習得。

subclassFeature.name: 魔射手學識
entries: 在3級時，通常為了成為這個精靈軍事傳統的實踐者，你習得魔法理論或一部分的自然奧秘—。你選擇獲得{@skill 奧秘}或{@skill 自然}技能的熟練，且你選擇習得{@spell 魔法技倆}或{@spell 德魯伊伎倆}戲法。

subclassFeature.name: 祕法射擊
entries: 在3級時，你習得在你其中一些射擊中釋放出特別的魔法效果。當你獲得此能力時，你習得二個由你選擇的祕法射擊選項（參見下列的「秘法射擊選項」）。
每個回合一次，當你使用{@item 短弓|phb}或{@item 長弓|phb}並做為{@action 攻擊}動作的一部份射出一發箭矢，你可以將你的其中一個祕法射擊選項應用於該箭矢。除非該選項不涉及攻擊檢定，否則你可以在箭矢命中一個生物時才決定是否使用該選項。你可以使用這個能力二次，且你在完成一次短休或長休後恢復所有你花費掉的次數。
你將在升至7級、10級、15級、和18級時獲得一個額外的祕法射擊選項。每個選項也都會在你成為一名18級戰士時獲得強化。

subclassFeature.name: 祕法射擊選項
entries: 祕法射擊能力讓你得以在特定等級時選擇選項。這些選項將在以下按照字母順序排列呈現。它們全都是魔法效果，且每個選項都各自對應著一個魔法學派。
若某個選項要求進行一次豁免檢定，則你的祕法射擊豁免檢定DC的計算方式如下：

subclassFeature.name: 額外祕法射擊選項
entries: 當你升至7級時，你獲得一個你所選擇的祕法射擊選項。

subclassFeature.name: 曲射
entries: 在7級時，你學會如何將偏離的箭矢導向一個新的目標。當你使用魔法箭矢進行一次攻擊檢定並失手時，你可以使用一個附贈動作以對一個距離原本目標60呎內的不同目標重骰該攻擊檢定。

subclassFeature.name: 魔法箭矢
entries: 在7級時，你獲得將魔法注入箭矢的能力。每當你使用{@item 短弓|phb}或{@item 長弓|phb}射出一發非魔法箭矢，你可以使其在克服對非魔法攻擊和傷害的抗性和免疫時被視作魔法箭矢。這個魔法將在它命中目標或失手時立刻從箭矢上消退。

subclassFeature.name: 額外祕法射擊選項
entries: 當你升至10級時，你獲得一個你所選擇的祕法射擊選項。

subclassFeature.name: 額外祕法射擊選項
entries: 當你升至15級時，你獲得一個你所選擇的祕法射擊選項。

subclassFeature.name: 常備射擊
entries: 從15級開始，每當戰鬥開始時，你都可以使用你的魔法箭術。當你骰先攻時且祕法射擊已經沒有剩下的使用次數，則你恢復一次使用次數。

subclassFeature.name: 額外祕法射擊選項
entries: 當你升至18級時，你獲得一個你所選擇的祕法射擊選項。每個祕法射擊選項也都會在你成為一名18級戰士時獲得強化。

subclassFeature.name: 騎兵
entries: 這種範型擅長於騎乘作戰。通常出身貴族，並在宮廷成長，騎兵既能在家鄉領導騎兵隊衝鋒陷陣，也能在國宴中侃侃而談。騎兵們也學習如何保護那些他們負責的人們不受傷害，並經常做為他們長官或弱者的保護者。被迫於懲奸除惡或贏取榮耀，許多這些戰士選擇離開他們安逸的生活，展開他們的光榮冒險。

subclassFeature.name: 額外熟練
entries: 當你在3級時選擇此範型時，你獲得下列其中一個你所選擇技能的熟練：{@skill 動物馴養}、{@skill 歷史}、{@skill 察言觀色}、{@skill 表演}、或{@skill 說服}。或者，你學會一個你所選擇的語言。

subclassFeature.name: 生而為騎
entries: 從3級開始，你做為騎兵的專業變得顯而易見。你在進行避免從你的坐騎摔落的豁免檢定中具有優勢。若你從你的坐騎摔落且落下不超過10呎距離，只要你不處於{@condition 無力}狀態，你就可以雙腳著地。
最後，乘上或騎下一個生物只花費你5呎的移動速度，而非你移動速度的一半。

subclassFeature.name: 堅定印記
entries: 從3級開始，你可以威脅你的敵人，挫敗它們的攻擊並為傷害他人而懲罰它們。當你以一次近戰武器攻擊命中一個生物，你可以標記該生物直到你的下個回合結束。這個效果會在你陷入{@condition 無力}狀態、你死亡、或者其他人標記該生物時提早結束。
當一個被標記的生物距離你5呎內，它將在任何不以你為目標的攻擊檢定中具有劣勢。
此外，若一個被你標記的生物對你以外的任何對象造成傷害，你可以在你的下個回合以一個附贈動作對該被標記的生物進行一次特殊的近戰武器攻擊。你在該攻擊檢定中具有優勢，且若命中，該攻擊的武器將對目標造成等同於你戰士等級一半的額外傷害。
無論你標記了多少生物，你能夠進行這個特殊攻擊的次數等同於你的力量調整值（最少一次），且你在完成一次長休後恢復所有你花費掉的次數。

subclassFeature.name: 防護戰術
entries: 在7級時，你學會抵禦對你、你的坐騎、或其他附近生物直接進行的攻擊。若你或一個距離你5呎內且你所能看見的生物被一次攻擊命中，且若你正持用一把近戰武器或盾牌，則你能夠以一個反應骰一顆{@dice 1d8}。骰這顆骰子，並將骰出來的數字加入目標對該次攻擊的AC中。若該攻擊仍然命中，則目標對該次攻擊的傷害將具有抗性。
你可以使用這個能力的次數等同於你的體質調整值（最少一次），且你在完成一次長休後恢復所有你花費掉的次數。

subclassFeature.name: 堅守戰線
entries: 在10級時，你成為了封鎖你敵人行動的專家。處於你觸及範圍內的生物將在移動5呎或以上距離時引發來自你的藉機攻擊，且若你以一次藉機攻擊命中一個生物，目標的移動速度將被歸零直到該回合結束。

subclassFeature.name: 勇猛衝鋒
entries: 從15級開始，無論你是否乘騎，你都可以撞倒你的敵人。若你在攻擊一個生物之前直線移動至少10呎，且該攻擊命中，則目標必須成功通過一次力量豁免（DC為8+你的熟練加值+你的力量調整值），否則被擊倒{@condition 伏地}你在每個你的回合只能使用這個能力一次。

subclassFeature.name: 警戒防衛者
entries: 從18級開始，你能以超凡警戒回應危險。在戰鬥中，你得到一個你可以在每個生物的回合（除了你的回合以外）採取一次的特殊反應。你只能使用這個特殊反應以進行一次藉機攻擊，且你不能在你採取你正常反應的同個回合使用它。

subclassFeature.name: 武士
entries: 武士是一種以堅決戰鬥意志擊潰敵人的戰士。武士的信念幾乎堅不可摧，且擋在武士道路前的敵人只有兩種選擇：投降，或者死戰方休。

subclassFeature.name: 額外熟練
entries: 當你在3級時選擇此範型時，你獲得下列其中一個你所選擇技能的熟練：{@skill 歷史}、{@skill 察言觀色}、{@skill 表演}、或{@skill 說服}。或者，你學會一個你所選擇的語言。

subclassFeature.name: 戰鬥之魂
entries: 從3級開始，你在戰鬥中的強烈氣勢可以保護你並助你一擊必中。在你的回合以一個附贈動作，你可以讓你自己在該回合結束前的武器攻擊檢定都具有優勢。當你這麼做時，你同時獲得5點臨時生命值。這個臨時生命值的數量將會在你本職業升至特定等級時增加，10級時增加至10點，15級時增加至15。
你可以使用這個能力三次，且你在完成一次長休後恢復所有你花費掉的次數。

subclassFeature.name: 典雅侍臣
entries: 從7級開始，你的修養和對細節的專注讓你得以在社交場合嶄露頭角。每當你進行一次魅力（{@skill 說服}）檢定時，你將在該檢定中獲得等同於你睿知調整值的加值。
你的自我控制能力同時也讓你獲得了睿知豁免的熟練。若你已經擁有此熟練，則你可以改為獲得智力豁免或魅力豁免的熟練（由你選擇）。

subclassFeature.name: 不懈戰魂
entries: 從10級開始，當你骰先攻時且戰鬥之魂已經沒有剩下的使用次數，則你恢復一次使用次數。

subclassFeature.name: 迅捷打擊
entries: 從15級開始，你學會以準確度換取快速打擊的方式。若你在你的回合採取{@action 攻擊}動作，且在對其中一個目標所進行的一次攻擊檢定中具有優勢，你可以放棄該檢定的優勢，並做為同個動作的一部份對該目標進行一次額外的武器攻擊。你每回合可以這麼做不超過一次。

subclassFeature.name: 迴光返照
entries: 從18級開始，你的戰鬥意志可以延後死亡的支配。若你受到將你生命值歸零但沒有當場殺死你的傷害，你可以使用你的反應以延後陷入{@condition 昏迷}的時機，且你可以中斷當前的回合並立刻進行一個額外的回合。當你在這個額外回合期間的擁有0點生命值，受到傷害仍然會如往常一樣導致一次失敗的死亡豁免，且三次死亡豁免失敗仍然會殺死你。當這個額外回合結束時，若你的生命值依舊為0點，你將陷入{@condition 昏迷}。
一旦你使用此能力，直到你完成一次長休之前你都不能再使用它。

subclassFeature.name: 庇護力場
entries: 當你或者另一個在你 30 尺內可見的生物受到傷害時，你可以使用一個反應動作消耗一枚靈能骰，來瞬間創造一面念力盾牌來降低那次的傷害，降低的數值為 靈能骰骰值 + 你的智力調整值（最少降低 1 點）。

subclassFeature.name: 靈能打擊
entries: 你可以用靈能驅動你的武器。你的每回合一次，當你使用武器命中並對 30 尺以內的目標造成傷害時，你可以立即消耗一個靈能骰，對目標造成 等同於靈能骰骰值 + 你的智力調整值 點力場傷害。

subclassFeature.name: 念力控物
entries: 你可以用意念移動一個物體或生物。你可以使用一個動作選擇一個體型為大型或更小的物體或一個除你以外的自願生物。如果目標在你 30 尺的可視範圍內，你可以將其移動至多 30 尺至一個可視且未被佔據的位置內。另外，如果目標是一個小型物件，則你可以將其移出或移進你的手中。無論採取哪種方式，你都能以水平、垂直或兩者皆用的方式移動它。當你使用此異能時，你無法再使用此能力直到你完成一次短休或長休，除非你消耗一個靈能骰，才能再次使用此異能。

subclassFeature.name: 靈能躍動
entries: 你能以你的意志來驅使你的身體。你可以使用一個附贈動作，獲得等同於步行速度兩倍的飛行速度，直到那個回合結束。當你使用了這個附贈動作，你無法再次使用此異能，直到你完成一次短休或長休，除非你消耗一個靈能骰，才能再次使用此異能。

subclassFeature.name: 念力推移
entries: 當你使用靈能打擊對一個目標造成傷害時，你可以迫使目標進行一次DC為 8 + 你的熟練加值 + 你的智力調整值的力量豁免。如果豁免失敗，你可以讓目標{@condition 伏地}或者將其在任意方向水平移動至多 10 尺。
